summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting the interview of Anthony Figueroa on August 19, 2020. Figueroa describes his relationship with a girlfriend (name redacted) who worked for Jeffrey Epstein, his role in recruiting girls for massages for Epstein, and his limited interactions with Ghislaine Maxwell. The interview provides details on the recruitment process, payments, and the dynamics between Epstein, Maxwell, and the recruiter.

persons.name: Anthony Figueroa
persons.role: Interview subject, former recruiter for Epstein
persons.context: Interviewed by FBI and a detective. Describes dating a woman who worked for Epstein, recruiting girls for Epstein's massages, and receiving cash payments from Epstein for each girl.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as paying for an apartment, paying Figueroa $200 cash per girl recruited, traveling with Figueroa's girlfriend, and requesting massages from young girls.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to a lawsuit deposition, allegedly approached Figueroa's girlfriend at Mar-A-Lago, and was described as going out with the girlfriend to get girls for Epstein.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Deposed Figueroa approximately five years prior regarding a lawsuit pertaining to Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Michael
persons.context: Mentioned as the man Figueroa's girlfriend was engaged to before reconnecting with Figueroa.

persons.name: Sean
persons.context: Described as a friend of Figueroa from Survivors High School and the boyfriend of a girl Figueroa recruited for Epstein.

connections.description: Epstein paid Figueroa $200 in cash for each girl he recruited and brought to Epstein's residence. Epstein also promised to pay Figueroa's phone bill.
Figueroa met Maxwell a couple of times and spoke briefly. He stated Maxwell may have called him once or twice regarding picking up girls, but he did not deal with her much.
Figueroa's girlfriend told him that she and Maxwell would go out and get girls together for Epstein.
Edwards deposed Figueroa for a lawsuit pertaining to Ghislaine Maxwell approximately five years prior to this interview.

events.title: FBI Interview of Anthony Figueroa
events.description: Anthony Figueroa was interviewed via video conference by a detective and an FBI Special Agent regarding his knowledge of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Figueroa Deposed by Brad Edwards
events.description: Anthony Figueroa was deposed by attorney Brad Edwards for a lawsuit pertaining to Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Recruitment of Girls for Epstein
events.description: Figueroa recruited girls, including acquaintances from high school, to give massages to Jeffrey Epstein for cash payment. Epstein gave instructions to ensure girls were 18 and 'not fat.'

events.title: Girlfriend's Travel to Thailand
events.description: Figueroa's girlfriend traveled to Thailand, after which Epstein repeatedly called Figueroa looking for her. During this time, Epstein promised to pay Figueroa's phone bill but never did.

keyFacts: Anthony Figueroa was paid $200 in cash by Jeffrey Epstein for each girl he recruited and brought to Epstein's residence for massages.
Figueroa's girlfriend (name redacted) worked for Epstein as a traveling massage therapist, and she told Figueroa that she and Ghislaine Maxwell would go out together to get girls for Epstein.
Epstein gave specific instructions to Figueroa regarding recruitment: ensure the girls were 18 years old and 'not fat.'
Figueroa stated that Epstein would ask the girls to do more than massage during sessions, and sometimes girls would get paid more for doing so, but it was not required.

The document references a prior FBI statement (31E-MM-108062 serial #104) where Figueroa allegedly said Maxwell would call him to pick up specific girls, though in this interview he did not fully recall that statement.
